results.title: Mediterranean Cookery Egypt,Turkey,Morocco and Greece
results.brief_description: Mediterranean cuisine is one of intense flavours, brilliant colours and simple clean tastes. Attractive, healthy and delicious food reflecting the sun and the sea. A real gourmet’s delight. In this video, Claudia Roden celebrates the exotic cooking of Egypt, Turkey, Morocco and Greece. The culinary diversity of the region is indicated by the wide range of traditional specialities demonstrated by top chefs and talented home cooks. But all the dishes share the characteristic produce of the area: fish straight from the sea, olives and olive oil, grains and pulses, garlic and a myriad of herbs and spices. Here are 23 irresistible recipes to help you recapture the magic of the Mediterranean. Rated: G

results.title: Mediterranean Cookery-France,Italy and Spain
results.brief_description: In this video, Claudia Roden celebrates the cooking of France, Italy and Spain. Top chefs and talented home cooks demonstrate authentic dishes from each country using widely available ingredients. World famous recipes and local specialties are featured, all using luscious Mediterranean produce such as fish straight from the sea, olives and olive oil, lemon, garlic and an abundance of fresh vegetables. Here are 27 mouth watering recipes to help you recapture the magic of the Mediterranean. Rated: G

results.title: Mediterranean climate of France
results.creator_credit: Les Films du Sagittaire and Centre Audio-Visuel
results.brief_description: Shows how the Mediterranean climate affects vegetation. The acute shortage of water in summer and the vital necessity for irrigation is shown, also characteristic villages and farmhouses and the grape harvest. Autumn is a time of violent storms punctuated with brief periods of sunshine enabling cultivation of crops and flowers to continue, in spite of the mistral winds of the season.

results.title: Meditation on violence
results.brief_description: A study of a dancer in which the dance movements follow, in general, the sequence which has, for several centuries, been in traditional training usage of two schools of Chinese boxing - the Wu-tang and Shao-Lin. Performed by the dancer, Ch’ao-Li Chi, the dance in this film is accompanied by music played on the Chinese flute and Haitian drums. No commentary, music only.

results.title: Meditation in motion
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Tom Daly and Irene Angelico
results.brief_description: A short lyrical document about an ancient Oriental discipline, this film moves from the streets of China, where the people practice Tai-Chi daily, to North America, where the same movements are executed by a solitary figure in a park. Tai-chi ch’uan performed by Leslie Orr. (Award: New York)

results.title: Meditation
results.creator_credit: Reel Images, SBS-TV, Brian Beaton and Celia Tait
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “The Nature of healing”.
Meditation is an ancient practice used to enhance enlightenment by altering metabolic processes to induce restfulness. Business people, patients and school students, in fact, everyone can benefit from the various therapies shwon if meditation is part of a daily routine.

results.title: Medieval World
results.brief_description: Begins by showing some of the remnants of the medieval world to be found in European cities, beginning with York. The growth of cities and the necessity for protection provided by fortified towns is explained. The film then shows how religious belief helped to bring about the expansion of the medieval world by means of the Crusades. The demand for products of the East stimulated trade and new centres of trade arose. Ghent, a typical town of the Middle Ages, is described in the film. The Cathedral of Chartres is also shown. Finally, in the Middle Ages, arose such great universities as Paris, Bologna, Cambridge and Oxford.

results.title: Medieval times: the role of the church
results.brief_description: Uses costumed re-enactments to show the vast influences of the church on the nobility, scholars, clergy and the peasants of the Middle Ages, and the role of the church in shaping European history then and in centuries to come. Includes views of churches and cathedrals of Europe and of medieval art.

results.title: Medieval society: the villagers
results.brief_description: Depicts a typical village of 1128 A.D. in England. Various villagers such as a bailiff, serf, reeve, miller, carpenter, swineherd, priest, shepherd and potter briefly explain their lives. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Medieval society
results.creator_credit: Gateway Film Productions and W. Hugh Baddeley
results.brief_description: Provides an overview of 14th century life in England by showing the work and responsibilities of a range of medieval people. Discusses the roles of the King, the church, the barons and the tenants.
